headers.subject: [tosdr:2132] [bad] ToS;DR does not follow its own privacy policy?

html:
According to the privacy policy, "we do not use cookies". That may be true, but upon visiting the site a cookie is set by Flattr, and a session key is written to the local store by 5apps. Shouldn't a privacy policy mention that?

--
tosdr.org | twitter.com/tosdr | github.com/tosdr

subject: [bad] ToS;DR does not follow its own privacy policy?
text:
According to the privacy policy, "we do not use cookies". That may be true, 
but upon visiting the site a cookie is set by Flattr, and a session key is 
written to the local store by 5apps. Shouldn't a privacy policy mention 
that?
